titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather was unattractive, and the fact may go some way to explain the smallness of the congregation at the Cathedral when I preached at Mattins. The coughing of the Cheetham Hospital boys caused me much annoyance, but it had the sound of a genuine epidemic. At Evensong there was a large congregation, & it was very attentive.
